vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `bzip2` package and not the `bzip2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

BZ2_decompress in decompress.c in bzip2 through 1.0.6 has an out-of-bounds write when there are many selectors.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `bzip2` to version 1.0.6-r7 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.34.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a heap out-of-bounds read in the code handling the end-of-response for SMTP. If the buffer passed to `smtp_endofresp()` isn't NUL terminated and contains no character ending the parsed number, and `len` is set to 5, then the `strtol()` call reads beyond the allocated buffer. The read contents will not be returned to the caller.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References
- [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8338a0f605bdbb3a6098bb76f666a95fc2b2f53f37fa1ecc89f1146f@%3Cdevnull.infra.apache.org%3E)

- [Debian Security Advisory](https://www.debian.org/security/2019/dsa-4386)

vulnerabilities.name: curl/curl

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 is vulnerable to a heap buffer out-of-bounds read. The function handling incoming NTLM type-2 messages (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:ntlm_decode_type2_target`) does not validate incoming data correctly and is subject to an integer overflow vulnerability. Using that overflow, a malicious or broken NTLM server could trick libcurl to accept a bad length + offset combination that would lead to a buffer read out-of-bounds.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References
- [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8338a0f605bdbb3a6098bb76f666a95fc2b2f53f37fa1ecc89f1146f@%3Cdevnull.infra.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.name: curl/curl

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. The function creating an outgoing NTLM type-3 header (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:Curl_auth_create_ntlm_type3_message()`), generates the request HTTP header contents based on previously received data. The check that exists to prevent the local buffer from getting overflowed is implemented wrongly (using unsigned math) and as such it does not prevent the overflow from happening. This output data can grow larger than the local buffer if very large 'nt response' data is extracted from a previous NTLMv2 header provided by the malicious or broken HTTP server. Such a 'large value' needs to be around 1000 bytes or more. The actual payload data copied to the target buffer comes from the NTLMv2 type-2 response header.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References
- [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8338a0f605bdbb3a6098bb76f666a95fc2b2f53f37fa1ecc89f1146f@%3Cdevnull.infra.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

curl before version 7.61.1 is vulnerable to a buffer overrun in the NTLM authentication code. The internal function Curl_ntlm_core_mk_nt_hash multiplies the length of the password by two (SUM) to figure out how large temporary storage area to allocate from the heap. The length value is then subsequently used to iterate over the password and generate output into the allocated storage buffer. On systems with a 32 bit size_t, the math to calculate SUM triggers an integer overflow when the password length exceeds 2GB (2^31 bytes). This integer overflow usually causes a very small buffer to actually get allocated instead of the intended very huge one, making the use of that buffer end up in a heap buffer overflow. (This bug is almost identical to CVE-2017-8816.)
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r0 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

A heap use-after-free flaw was found in curl versions from 7.59.0 through 7.61.1 in the code related to closing an easy handle. When closing and cleaning up an 'easy' handle in the `Curl_close()` function, the library code first frees a struct (without nulling the pointer) and might then subsequently erroneously write to a struct field within that already freed struct.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r1 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Buffer Overflow
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.34.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a heap out-of-bounds read in the code handling the end-of-response for SMTP. If the buffer passed to `smtp_endofresp()` isn't NUL terminated and contains no character ending the parsed number, and `len` is set to 5, then the `strtol()` call reads beyond the allocated buffer. The read contents will not be returned to the caller.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 is vulnerable to a heap buffer out-of-bounds read. The function handling incoming NTLM type-2 messages (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:ntlm_decode_type2_target`) does not validate incoming data correctly and is subject to an integer overflow vulnerability. Using that overflow, a malicious or broken NTLM server could trick libcurl to accept a bad length + offset combination that would lead to a buffer read out-of-bounds.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. The function creating an outgoing NTLM type-3 header (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:Curl_auth_create_ntlm_type3_message()`), generates the request HTTP header contents based on previously received data. The check that exists to prevent the local buffer from getting overflowed is implemented wrongly (using unsigned math) and as such it does not prevent the overflow from happening. This output data can grow larger than the local buffer if very large 'nt response' data is extracted from a previous NTLMv2 header provided by the malicious or broken HTTP server. Such a 'large value' needs to be around 1000 bytes or more. The actual payload data copied to the target buffer comes from the NTLMv2 type-2 response header.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References
- [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8338a0f605bdbb3a6098bb76f666a95fc2b2f53f37fa1ecc89f1146f@%3Cdevnull.infra.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

curl before version 7.61.1 is vulnerable to a buffer overrun in the NTLM authentication code. The internal function Curl_ntlm_core_mk_nt_hash multiplies the length of the password by two (SUM) to figure out how large temporary storage area to allocate from the heap. The length value is then subsequently used to iterate over the password and generate output into the allocated storage buffer. On systems with a 32 bit size_t, the math to calculate SUM triggers an integer overflow when the password length exceeds 2GB (2^31 bytes). This integer overflow usually causes a very small buffer to actually get allocated instead of the intended very huge one, making the use of that buffer end up in a heap buffer overflow. (This bug is almost identical to CVE-2017-8816.)
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r0 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

A heap use-after-free flaw was found in curl versions from 7.59.0 through 7.61.1 in the code related to closing an easy handle. When closing and cleaning up an 'easy' handle in the `Curl_close()` function, the library code first frees a struct (without nulling the pointer) and might then subsequently erroneously write to a struct field within that already freed struct.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r1 or higher.
## References

The function handling incoming NTLM type-2 messages (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:ntlm_decode_type2_target`) does not validate incoming data correctly and is subject to an integer overflow vulnerability. Using that overflow, a malicious or broken NTLM server could trick libcurl to accept a bad length + offset combination that would lead to a buffer read out-of-bounds.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.

vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. The function creating an outgoing NTLM type-3 header (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:Curl_auth_create_ntlm_type3_message()`), generates the request HTTP header contents based on previously received data. The check that exists to prevent the local buffer from getting overflowed is implemented wrongly (using unsigned math) and as such it does not prevent the overflow from happening. This output data can grow larger than the local buffer if very large 'nt response' data is extracted from a previous NTLMv2 header provided by the malicious or broken HTTP server. Such a 'large value' needs to be around 1000 bytes or more. The actual payload data copied to the target buffer comes from the NTLMv2 type-2 response header.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References
- [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8338a0f605bdbb3a6098bb76f666a95fc2b2f53f37fa1ecc89f1146f@%3Cdevnull.infra.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

A heap use-after-free flaw was found in curl versions from 7.59.0 through 7.61.1 in the code related to closing an easy handle. When closing and cleaning up an 'easy' handle in the `Curl_close()` function, the library code first frees a struct (without nulling the pointer) and might then subsequently erroneously write to a struct field within that already freed struct.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r1 or higher.
## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-16840)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.34.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a heap out-of-bounds read in the code handling the end-of-response for SMTP. If the buffer passed to `smtp_endofresp()` isn't NUL terminated and contains no character ending the parsed number, and `len` is set to 5, then the `strtol()` call reads beyond the allocated buffer. The read contents will not be returned to the caller.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References
- [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8338a0f605bdbb3a6098bb76f666a95fc2b2f53f37fa1ecc89f1146f@%3Cdevnull.infra.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

A heap use-after-free flaw was found in curl versions from 7.59.0 through 7.61.1 in the code related to closing an easy handle. When closing and cleaning up an 'easy' handle in the `Curl_close()` function, the library code first frees a struct (without nulling the pointer) and might then subsequently erroneously write to a struct field within that already freed struct.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r1 or higher.
## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-16840)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.34.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a heap out-of-bounds read in the code handling the end-of-response for SMTP. If the buffer passed to `smtp_endofresp()` isn't NUL terminated and contains no character ending the parsed number, and `len` is set to 5, then the `strtol()` call reads beyond the allocated buffer. The read contents will not be returned to the caller.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 is vulnerable to a heap buffer out-of-bounds read. The function handling incoming NTLM type-2 messages (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:ntlm_decode_type2_target`) does not validate incoming data correctly and is subject to an integer overflow vulnerability. Using that overflow, a malicious or broken NTLM server could trick libcurl to accept a bad length + offset combination that would lead to a buffer read out-of-bounds.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References
- [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8338a0f605bdbb3a6098bb76f666a95fc2b2f53f37fa1ecc89f1146f@%3Cdevnull.infra.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.name: curl/libcurl

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. The function creating an outgoing NTLM type-3 header (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:Curl_auth_create_ntlm_type3_message()`), generates the request HTTP header contents based on previously received data. The check that exists to prevent the local buffer from getting overflowed is implemented wrongly (using unsigned math) and as such it does not prevent the overflow from happening. This output data can grow larger than the local buffer if very large 'nt response' data is extracted from a previous NTLMv2 header provided by the malicious or broken HTTP server. Such a 'large value' needs to be around 1000 bytes or more. The actual payload data copied to the target buffer comes from the NTLMv2 type-2 response header.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References
- [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8338a0f605bdbb3a6098bb76f666a95fc2b2f53f37fa1ecc89f1146f@%3Cdevnull.infra.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.34.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a heap out-of-bounds read in the code handling the end-of-response for SMTP. If the buffer passed to `smtp_endofresp()` isn't NUL terminated and contains no character ending the parsed number, and `len` is set to 5, then the `strtol()` call reads beyond the allocated buffer. The read contents will not be returned to the caller.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References
- [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8338a0f605bdbb3a6098bb76f666a95fc2b2f53f37fa1ecc89f1146f@%3Cdevnull.infra.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 is vulnerable to a heap buffer out-of-bounds read. The function handling incoming NTLM type-2 messages (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:ntlm_decode_type2_target`) does not validate incoming data correctly and is subject to an integer overflow vulnerability. Using that overflow, a malicious or broken NTLM server could trick libcurl to accept a bad length + offset combination that would lead to a buffer read out-of-bounds.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References
- [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8338a0f605bdbb3a6098bb76f666a95fc2b2f53f37fa1ecc89f1146f@%3Cdevnull.infra.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. The function creating an outgoing NTLM type-3 header (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:Curl_auth_create_ntlm_type3_message()`), generates the request HTTP header contents based on previously received data. The check that exists to prevent the local buffer from getting overflowed is implemented wrongly (using unsigned math) and as such it does not prevent the overflow from happening. This output data can grow larger than the local buffer if very large 'nt response' data is extracted from a previous NTLMv2 header provided by the malicious or broken HTTP server. Such a 'large value' needs to be around 1000 bytes or more. The actual payload data copied to the target buffer comes from the NTLMv2 type-2 response header.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r2 or higher.
## References
- [Apache Security Advisory](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/8338a0f605bdbb3a6098bb76f666a95fc2b2f53f37fa1ecc89f1146f@%3Cdevnull.infra.apache.org%3E)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `curl` package and not the `curl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

A heap use-after-free flaw was found in curl versions from 7.59.0 through 7.61.1 in the code related to closing an easy handle. When closing and cleaning up an 'easy' handle in the `Curl_close()` function, the library code first frees a struct (without nulling the pointer) and might then subsequently erroneously write to a struct field within that already freed struct.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `curl` to version 7.61.1-r1 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.name: expat/expat

vulnerabilities.title: XML External Entity (XXE) Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `expat` package and not the `expat` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

In libexpat in Expat before 2.2.7, XML input including XML names that contain a large number of colons could make the XML parser consume a high amount of RAM and CPU resources while processing (enough to be usable for denial-of-service attacks).
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `expat` to version 2.2.7-r0 or higher.
## References
- [Bugtraq Mailing List](https://seclists.org/bugtraq/2019/Jun/39)

vulnerabilities.name: expat/expat

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `expat` package and not the `expat` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

In libexpat before 2.2.8, crafted XML input could fool the parser into changing from DTD parsing to document parsing too early; a consecutive call to XML_GetCurrentLineNumber (or XML_GetCurrentColumnNumber) then resulted in a heap-based buffer over-read.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `expat` to version 2.2.7-r1 or higher.

vulnerabilities.name: expat/expat

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `expat` package and not the `expat` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

In libexpat before 2.2.8, crafted XML input could fool the parser into changing from DTD parsing to document parsing too early; a consecutive call to XML_GetCurrentLineNumber (or XML_GetCurrentColumnNumber) then resulted in a heap-based buffer over-read.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `expat` to version 2.2.7-r1 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: XML External Entity (XXE) Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `expat` package and not the `expat` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

In libexpat in Expat before 2.2.7, XML input including XML names that contain a large number of colons could make the XML parser consume a high amount of RAM and CPU resources while processing (enough to be usable for denial-of-service attacks).
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `expat` to version 2.2.7-r0 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2019-1348
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `git` package and not the `git` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was found in Git before v2.24.1, v2.23.1, v2.22.2, v2.21.1, v2.20.2, v2.19.3, v2.18.2, v2.17.3, v2.16.6, v2.15.4, and v2.14.6. The --export-marks option of git fast-import is exposed also via the in-stream command feature export-marks=... and it allows overwriting arbitrary paths.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `git` to version 2.15.4-r0 or higher.
## References

A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Git for Visual Studio improperly sanitizes input, aka 'Git for Visual Studio Remote Code Execution Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2019-1349, CVE-2019-1352, CVE-2019-1354, CVE-2019-1387.

Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `git` to version 2.15.4-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2019-1353
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `git` package and not the `git` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was found in Git before v2.24.1, v2.23.1, v2.22.2, v2.21.1, v2.20.2, v2.19.3, v2.18.2, v2.17.3, v2.16.6, v2.15.4, and v2.14.6. When running Git in the Windows Subsystem for Linux (also known as "WSL") while accessing a working directory on a regular Windows drive, none of the NTFS protections were active.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `git` to version 2.15.4-r0 or higher.
## References

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `git` package and not the `git` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was found in Git before v2.24.1, v2.23.1, v2.22.2, v2.21.1, v2.20.2, v2.19.3, v2.18.2, v2.17.3, v2.16.6, v2.15.4, and v2.14.6. Recursive clones are currently affected by a vulnerability that is caused by too-lax validation of submodule names, allowing very targeted attacks via remote code execution in recursive clones.

Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `git` to version 2.15.4-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Arbitrary Argument Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `git` package and not the `git` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

Git before 2.14.5, 2.15.x before 2.15.3, 2.16.x before 2.16.5, 2.17.x before 2.17.2, 2.18.x before 2.18.1, and 2.19.x before 2.19.1 allows remote code execution during processing of a recursive "git clone" of a superproject if a .gitmodules file has a URL field beginning with a '-' character.

Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `git` to version 2.15.3-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libssh2` package and not the `libssh2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An out of bounds read flaw was discovered in libssh2 before 1.8.1 in the way SFTP packets with empty payloads are parsed. A remote attacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to cause a Denial of Service or read data in the client memory.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libssh2` to version 1.8.1-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libssh2` package and not the `libssh2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

A flaw was found in libssh2 before 1.8.1. A server could send a multiple keyboard interactive response messages whose total length are greater than unsigned char max characters. This value is used as an index to copy memory causing in an out of bounds memory write error.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libssh2` to version 1.8.1-r0 or higher.

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libssh2` package and not the `libssh2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._

An integer overflow flaw which could lead to an out of bounds write was discovered in libssh2 before 1.8.1 in the way packets are read from the server. A remote attacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to execute code on the client system when a user connects to the server.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libssh2` to version 1.8.1-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libssh2` package and not the `libssh2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An integer overflow flaw, which could lead to an out of bounds write, was discovered in libssh2 before 1.8.1 in the way keyboard prompt requests are parsed. A remote attacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to execute code on the client system when a user connects to the server.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libssh2` to version 1.8.1-r0 or higher.
## References

- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/security-advisory/cpuoct2019-5072832.html)

vulnerabilities.name: libssh2/libssh2

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libssh2` package and not the `libssh2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An out of bounds read flaw was discovered in libssh2 before 1.8.1 in the _libssh2_packet_require and _libssh2_packet_requirev functions. A remote attacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to cause a Denial of Service or read data in the client memory.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libssh2` to version 1.8.1-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.name: libssh2/libssh2

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libssh2` package and not the `libssh2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An out of bounds read flaw was discovered in libssh2 before 1.8.1 in the way SSH packets with a padding length value greater than the packet length are parsed. A remote attacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to cause a Denial of Service or read data in the client memory.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libssh2` to version 1.8.1-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.name: libssh2/libssh2

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libssh2` package and not the `libssh2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

The `SSH_MSG_DISCONNECT` logic in `packet.c` has an integer overflow in a bounds check, enabling an attacker to specify an arbitrary (out-of-bounds) offset for a subsequent memory read. A crafted SSH server may be able to disclose sensitive information or cause a denial of service condition on the client system when a user connects to the server.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libssh2` to version 1.9.0-r1 or higher.
## References
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/22H4Q5XMGS3QNSA7OCL3U7UQZ4NXMR5O/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/TY7EEE34RFKCTXTMBQQWWSLXZWSCXNDB/)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/kevinbackhouse/SecurityExploits/tree/8cbdbbe6363510f7d9ceec685373da12e6fc752d/libssh2/out_of_bounds_read_disconnect_CVE-2019-17498)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/libssh2/libssh2/pull/402/commits/1c6fa92b77e34d089493fe6d3e2c6c8775858b94)
- [GitHub Fix Commit](https://github.com/libssh2/libssh2/blob/42d37aa63129a1b2644bf6495198923534322d64/src/packet.c#L480)
- [MISC](https://github.com/libssh2/libssh2/commit/dedcbd106f8e52d5586b0205bc7677e4c9868f9c)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/11/msg00010.html)
- [Semmle Blogpost](https://blog.semmle.com/libssh2-integer-overflow-CVE-2019-17498/)
- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-11/msg00026.html)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/12/msg00013.html)
- [cve@mitre.org](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20220909-0004/)

vulnerabilities.name: libssh2/libssh2

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libssh2` package and not the `libssh2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

A flaw was found in libssh2 before 1.8.1. A server could send a multiple keyboard interactive response messages whose total length are greater than unsigned char max characters. This value is used as an index to copy memory causing in an out of bounds memory write error.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libssh2` to version 1.8.1-r0 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libssh2` package and not the `libssh2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An integer overflow flaw, which could lead to an out of bounds write, was discovered in libssh2 before 1.8.1 in the way keyboard prompt requests are parsed. A remote attacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to execute code on the client system when a user connects to the server.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libssh2` to version 1.8.1-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libssh2` package and not the `libssh2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

The `SSH_MSG_DISCONNECT` logic in `packet.c` has an integer overflow in a bounds check, enabling an attacker to specify an arbitrary (out-of-bounds) offset for a subsequent memory read. A crafted SSH server may be able to disclose sensitive information or cause a denial of service condition on the client system when a user connects to the server.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libssh2` to version 1.9.0-r1 or higher.
## References
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/22H4Q5XMGS3QNSA7OCL3U7UQZ4NXMR5O/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/TY7EEE34RFKCTXTMBQQWWSLXZWSCXNDB/)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/kevinbackhouse/SecurityExploits/tree/8cbdbbe6363510f7d9ceec685373da12e6fc752d/libssh2/out_of_bounds_read_disconnect_CVE-2019-17498)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/libssh2/libssh2/pull/402/commits/1c6fa92b77e34d089493fe6d3e2c6c8775858b94)
- [GitHub Fix Commit](https://github.com/libssh2/libssh2/blob/42d37aa63129a1b2644bf6495198923534322d64/src/packet.c#L480)
- [MISC](https://github.com/libssh2/libssh2/commit/dedcbd106f8e52d5586b0205bc7677e4c9868f9c)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/11/msg00010.html)

- [cve@mitre.org](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20220909-0004/)

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libxml2` package and not the `libxml2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

libxml2 2.9.8, if --with-lzma is used, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a crafted XML file that triggers LZMA_MEMLIMIT_ERROR, as demonstrated by xmllint, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-8035 and CVE-2018-9251.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libxml2` to version 2.9.8-r1 or higher.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/commit/2240fbf5912054af025fb6e01e26375100275e74)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-14567)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/09/msg00035.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-14567)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/09/msg00009.html)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/105198)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-14567)
- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3739-1/)
vulnerabilities.name: libxml2/libxml2

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `libxml2` package and not the `libxml2` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

A NULL pointer dereference vulnerability exists in the xpath.c:xmlXPathCompOpEval() function of libxml2 through 2.9.8 when parsing an invalid XPath expression in the XPATH_OP_AND or XPATH_OP_OR case. Applications processing untrusted XSL format inputs with the use of the libxml2 library may be vulnerable to a denial of service attack due to a crash of the application.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `libxml2` to version 2.9.8-r1 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `musl` package and not the `musl` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

musl libc through 1.1.23 has an x87 floating-point stack adjustment imbalance, related to the math/i386/ directory. In some cases, use of this library could introduce out-of-bounds writes that are not present in an application's source code.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `musl` to version 1.1.18-r4 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-14697)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-14697)

- [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/musl/2019/08/06/1)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/08/06/4)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Encoding or Escaping of Output
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in OpenSSH 7.9. Due to missing character encoding in the progress display, a malicious server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can employ crafted object names to manipulate the client output, e.g., by using ANSI control codes to hide additional files being transferred. This affects refresh_progress_meter() in progressmeter.c.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.
## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-6109)
- [Debian Security Advisory](https://www.debian.org/security/2019/dsa-4387)

- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-6109)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/W3YVQ2BPTOVDCFDVNC2GGF5P5ISFG37G/)

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

In OpenSSH 7.9, scp.c in the scp client allows remote SSH servers to bypass intended access restrictions via the filename of . or an empty filename. The impact is modifying the permissions of the target directory on the client side.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Directory Traversal
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in OpenSSH 7.9. Due to the scp implementation being derived from 1983 rcp, the server chooses which files/directories are sent to the client. However, the scp client only performs cursory validation of the object name returned (only directory traversal attacks are prevented). A malicious scp server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can overwrite arbitrary files in the scp client target directory. If recursive operation (-r) is performed, the server can manipulate subdirectories as well (for example, to overwrite the .ssh/authorized_keys file).
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Encoding or Escaping of Output
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in OpenSSH 7.9. Due to missing character encoding in the progress display, a malicious server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can employ crafted object names to manipulate the client output, e.g., by using ANSI control codes to hide additional files being transferred. This affects refresh_progress_meter() in progressmeter.c.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in OpenSSH 7.9. Due to missing character encoding in the progress display, a malicious server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can employ crafted object names to manipulate the client output, e.g., by using ANSI control codes to hide additional files being transferred. This affects refresh_progress_meter() in progressmeter.c.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

In OpenSSH 7.9, scp.c in the scp client allows remote SSH servers to bypass intended access restrictions via the filename of . or an empty filename. The impact is modifying the permissions of the target directory on the client side.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Directory Traversal
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in OpenSSH 7.9. Due to the scp implementation being derived from 1983 rcp, the server chooses which files/directories are sent to the client. However, the scp client only performs cursory validation of the object name returned (only directory traversal attacks are prevented). A malicious scp server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can overwrite arbitrary files in the scp client target directory. If recursive operation (-r) is performed, the server can manipulate subdirectories as well (for example, to overwrite the .ssh/authorized_keys file).
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Encoding or Escaping of Output
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in OpenSSH 7.9. Due to missing character encoding in the progress display, a malicious server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can employ crafted object names to manipulate the client output, e.g., by using ANSI control codes to hide additional files being transferred. This affects refresh_progress_meter() in progressmeter.c.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Authorization
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

In OpenSSH 7.9, scp.c in the scp client allows remote SSH servers to bypass intended access restrictions via the filename of . or an empty filename. The impact is modifying the permissions of the target directory on the client side.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Directory Traversal
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in OpenSSH 7.9. Due to the scp implementation being derived from 1983 rcp, the server chooses which files/directories are sent to the client. However, the scp client only performs cursory validation of the object name returned (only directory traversal attacks are prevented). A malicious scp server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can overwrite arbitrary files in the scp client target directory. If recursive operation (-r) is performed, the server can manipulate subdirectories as well (for example, to overwrite the .ssh/authorized_keys file).
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.
## References

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._

An issue was discovered in OpenSSH 7.9. vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

In OpenSSH 7.9, scp.c in the scp client allows remote SSH servers to bypass intended access restrictions via the filename of . or an empty filename. The impact is modifying the permissions of the target directory on the client side.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Directory Traversal
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in OpenSSH 7.9. Due to the scp implementation being derived from 1983 rcp, the server chooses which files/directories are sent to the client. However, the scp client only performs cursory validation of the object name returned (only directory traversal attacks are prevented). A malicious scp server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can overwrite arbitrary files in the scp client target directory. If recursive operation (-r) is performed, the server can manipulate subdirectories as well (for example, to overwrite the .ssh/authorized_keys file).
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Directory Traversal
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `openssh` package and not the `openssh` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

An issue was discovered in OpenSSH 7.9. Due to the scp implementation being derived from 1983 rcp, the server chooses which files/directories are sent to the client. However, the scp client only performs cursory validation of the object name returned (only directory traversal attacks are prevented). A malicious scp server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can overwrite arbitrary files in the scp client target directory. If recursive operation (-r) is performed, the server can manipulate subdirectories as well (for example, to overwrite the .ssh/authorized_keys file).
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `openssh` to version 7.5_p1-r10 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `patch` package and not the `patch` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

GNU Patch version 2.7.6 contains an input validation vulnerability when processing patch files, specifically the EDITOR_PROGRAM invocation (using ed) can result in code execution. This attack appear to be exploitable via a patch file processed via the patch utility. This is similar to FreeBSD's CVE-2015-1418 however although they share a common ancestry the code bases have diverged over time.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `patch` to version 2.7.6-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: OS Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `patch` package and not the `patch` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

GNU patch through 2.7.6 is vulnerable to OS shell command injection that can be exploited by opening a crafted patch file that contains an ed style diff payload with shell metacharacters. The ed editor does not need to be present on the vulnerable system. This is different from CVE-2018-1000156.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `patch` to version 2.7.6-r0 or higher.

SQLite3 from 3.6.0 to and including 3.27.2 is vulnerable to heap out-of-bound read in the rtreenode() function when handling invalid rtree tables.

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `sqlite` package and not the `sqlite` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

SQLite before 3.25.3, when the FTS3 extension is enabled, encounters an integer overflow (and resultant buffer overflow) for FTS3 queries that occur after crafted changes to FTS3 shadow tables, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging the ability to run arbitrary SQL statements (such as in certain WebSQL use cases), aka Magellan.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `sqlite` to version 3.25.3-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `sqlite` package and not the `sqlite` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

SQLite3 from 3.6.0 to and including 3.27.2 is vulnerable to heap out-of-bound read in the rtreenode() function when handling invalid rtree tables.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `sqlite` to version 3.25.3-r1 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `sqlite` package and not the `sqlite` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

SQLite before 3.25.3, when the FTS3 extension is enabled, encounters an integer overflow (and resultant buffer overflow) for FTS3 queries that occur after crafted changes to FTS3 shadow tables, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging the ability to run arbitrary SQL statements (such as in certain WebSQL use cases), aka Magellan.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `sqlite` to version 3.25.3-r0 or higher.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `subversion` package and not the `subversion` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

In Apache Subversion versions up to and including 1.9.10, 1.10.4, 1.12.0, Subversion's svnserve server process may exit when a well-formed read-only request produces a particular answer. This can lead to disruption for users of the server.
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `subversion` to version 1.9.12-r0 or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-11782)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-11782)
- [MISC](http://subversion.apache.org/security/CVE-2018-11782-advisory.txt)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-11782)

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply only to the upstream `tar` package and not the `tar` package as distributed by `Alpine:3.7`._
_See `How to fix?` for `Alpine:3.7` relevant fixed versions and status._

GNU Tar through 1.30, when --sparse is used, mishandles file shrinkage during read access, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (infinite read loop in sparse_dump_region in sparse.c) by modifying a file that is supposed to be archived by a different user's process (e.g., a system backup running as root).
## Remediation
Upgrade `Alpine:3.7` `tar` to version 1.31-r0 or higher.
## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20482)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/12/msg00023.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Denial of Service (DoS)
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[golang.org/x/net/http2](https://pkg.go.dev/golang.org/x/net@v0.0.0-20211209100829-84cba5454caf/http2#section-readme) is a work-in-progress HTTP/2 implementation for Go.
Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) due to improper checks and limitations for the number of entries in the cache, which can allow an attacker to consume unbounded amounts of memory by sending a small number of very large keys.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `golang.org/x/net/http2` to version 0.4.0 or higher.
## References
- [Fix Commit](https://cs.opensource.google/go/x/net/+/1e63c2f08a10a150fa02c50ece89b340ae64efe4)
- [Fix Commit](https://go-review.googlesource.com/c/net/+/455635)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/golang/net/commit/1e63c2f08a10a150fa02c50ece89b340ae64efe4)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/golang/go/issues/56350)
vulnerabilities.name: golang.org/x/net/http2

vulnerabilities.title: Denial of Service (DoS)
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[golang.org/x/net/http2](https://pkg.go.dev/golang.org/x/net@v0.0.0-20211209100829-84cba5454caf/http2#section-readme) is a work-in-progress HTTP/2 implementation for Go.
Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) such that a maliciously crafted HTTP/2 stream could cause excessive CPU consumption in the `HPACK` decoder.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `golang.org/x/net/http2` to version 0.7.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/golang/go/commit/97fe3a23b68dd2df748f2369827aeab2420e0930)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/golang/net/commit/8e2b117aee74f6b86c207a808b0255de45c0a18a)

vulnerabilities.title: Privilege Escalation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/proxy](https://godoc.org/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/proxy) is a package that provides transport and upgrade support for proxies.
Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Privilege Escalation. If an attacker is able to intercept certain requests to the Kubelet, they can send a redirect response that may be followed by a client using the credentials from the original request. This can lead to compromise of other nodes.
## Remediation
Upgrade `k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/proxy` to version 0.19.0-rc.1 or higher.
